subject: Career
title: Digital Minimalism and Screen Boundaries
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Digital Minimalism and Screen Boundaries.

hook.text: He checks his phone 96 times a day. Each check fragments his attention and keeps his stress response simmering.

buildup.text: Cal Newport's Digital Minimalism: technology should serve your values. Most app usage serves the app company's values.

discovery.text: Each notification triggers a micro-stress response. Over a day, hundreds of micro-stresses compound.

twist.text: Removing social media for 30 days reduces anxiety by 25% in controlled studies. Most people feel better in days.

climax.text: Audit your phone: remove non-essential notifications, set app time limits, and designate phone-free zones.

punchline.text: Your phone is designed to steal your attention. Guard it like the resource it.

quiz.question: What does Cal Newport's Digital Minimalism argue?
options: Technology should serve your values, not the app company's
Use as many apps as possible
